title: Bongard-LOGO: A New Benchmark for Human-Level Concept Learning and Reasoning

sections.few-shot learning and meta-learning:
The goal of few-shot learning is to learn a new task (e.g., recognizing new object categories) from a small amount of training data.
Pioneer works have approached it with Bayesian inference  and metric learning 4. A rising trend is to formulate few-shot learning as meta-learning [ref]4 [ref]5. These methods can be categorized into three families: 1) memory-based methods, e.g., a variant of MANN  and SNAIL , 2) metric-based methods, e.g., Matching Networks  and ProtoNet , and 3) optimization-based methods, e.g., MAML [ref]5, MetaOptNet  and ANIL . Recent work   has achieved competitive or even better performances on few-shot image recognition benchmarks  6 with a simple pre-training baseline than advanced meta-learning algorithms.
It also sheds light on a rethinking of few-shot image classification benchmarks and the associated role of meta-learning algorithms.
